section.name: Facets
section.p: Hippo Repository is built on top of Apache Jackrabbit. Hippo Repository adds extra functionality to the default Jackrabbit distribution while keeping full compliance with JCR 1.0 JSR 170. The main added features are virtual nodes based on facets (metadata), access management, authorization and workflow.

section.name: Faceted navigation
section.p: Faceted navigation allows the assignment of multiple classifications to an object, enabling the classifications to be ordered in multiple ways, rather than a single, pre-determined order. This means objects can be navigated to along different paths, each based on different classifications or properties of those objects.

Hippo Repository supports a faceted representation of physical nodes. These representations are again exposed as 'normal' JCR nodes, and can be used to represent all kinds of data in all kinds of different structures purely defined by their meta information. This results in virtual node trees providing a faceted navigation.

subsection.name: Defining the facets
subsection.p: Facets are defined by nodes of type hippo:facetsearch. These nodes will form the root of the virtual folder structure. They have the following JCR properties:

ul.li:
hippo:queryname
The name of the query. You can choose any name you like.

hippo:docbase
The base physical folder whose contents will be used to generate the virtual folder

hippo:facets
This multivalued property contains the names of the properties that will be comprise the virtual folder structure.
